titlestmt.titleproper: George W. Bush coal freight receipts 1855-1871
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: George W. Bush coal freight receipts
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: George and George W. Bush were merchants in wood and coal, and were proprietors of the Wilmington and Philadelphia packets.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of receipts for freight on shipments of coal and wood shipped paid to the firm. The entries indicate the goods shipped, the quantity or weight, money received, and often the ship on which the goods were transported. The volume also includes expenses for labor, board for laborers, groceries, taxes, pew rental at the Central Presbyterian Church in Wilmington, and freight on other items.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Delaware: Bush family papers.
